title.narrative: Collaborative Investigation and Dissemination of Timorese Textile Traditions

description.narrative: In this project, local NGO Timor Aid is teaming up with UCLA's Fowler Museum to research, document, and promote the traditional weaving of Tais, a ceremonial cloth and essential part of Timor Leste's cultural heritage. Support for this project comes from the AFCP 20th Anniversary Partnership Program, a State Department special initiative.

title.narrative: Documentation of Endangered Ethnic Fataluku Cultural Heritage

description.narrative: To support documentation of endangered cultural heritage of the Fataluku, an ethnic group in Lospalos. Genocide, dislocation, and external social and economic pressures have interfered with the transmission of rituals, music, dance, and other cultural expressions to younger generations. The project focuses on specific cultural forms, documenting and promoting them as the first phase of a larger effort to preserve Fataluku heritage.

person-name.narrative: Jenee Sharon; Wes Aviles; Ryan Boles

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Department of State, Diplomatic and Consular Programs

title.narrative: Protecting Victims of Human Trafficking through Enhanced Partnership, Identification and Referral

description.narrative: IOM will enhance victim protection through increased partnerships, victim identification, and referrals.
